23 // Triple Buffering:
24 // Three buffers, A, B, C
25 // Display A, while drawing to B
26 // Swap, to display B, now drawing into C since cannot draw into A until swap is done
27 // Display C (swapping B into C), while drawing into A, since it is free now
28 // Swap A and C to...
29 // Display A, starting the process over
30 template<size_t N>
31 class FrameBufferQueue{
32 public:
33  //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
36 
38 
39  //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
43 
44  FrameBufferQueue()
45  {
46  }
47 
48  FrameBufferQueue(const FrameBufferQueue& other):
49  m_readBuffer(other.m_readBuffer),
50  m_writeBuffer(other.m_writeBuffer),
51  m_frameBuffers(other.m_frameBuffers)
52  {
53 
54  }
55 
58  template<typename ...BufferArgs>
59  FrameBufferQueue(BufferArgs&&... args):
60  m_frameBuffers([&] {
61  if constexpr (N == 2) {
62  // N == 2
63  return std::array<FrameBuffer, N>{ { FrameBuffer(std::forward<BufferArgs>(args)...), FrameBuffer(std::forward<BufferArgs>(args)...) } };
64  }
65  else {
66  // N == 3
67  return std::array<FrameBuffer, N>{ { FrameBuffer(std::forward<BufferArgs>(args)...), FrameBuffer(std::forward<BufferArgs>(args)...), FrameBuffer(std::forward<BufferArgs>(args)...) } };
68  }
69  }()
70  )// Immediate evaluation of lambda, lambdas are constexpr by default as of N4487 and P0170 of open-standard https://stackoverflow.com/questions/41011900/equivalent-ternary-operator-for-constexpr-if
71  {
72  static_assert(N == 2 || N == 3, "Error, framebuffer queue only supports two or three buffers");
73 
74  // Instead of a for loop, perform in-place construction of FBOs
75  //if constexpr (N == 2){
76  // m_frameBuffers = { { FrameBuffer(std::forward<BufferArgs>(args)...), FrameBuffer(std::forward<BufferArgs>(args)...) } };
77  //}
78  //else {
79  // // N == 3
80  // m_frameBuffers = { { FrameBuffer(std::forward<BufferArgs>(args)...), FrameBuffer(std::forward<BufferArgs>(args)...), FrameBuffer(std::forward<BufferArgs>(args)...) } };
81  //}
82  }
83 
84  ~FrameBufferQueue() {
85  }
86 
88 
89  //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
92 
93  FrameBuffer& writeBuffer() { return m_frameBuffers[m_writeBuffer]; }
94  const FrameBuffer& writeBuffer() const { return m_frameBuffers[m_writeBuffer]; }
95 
96  FrameBuffer& readBuffer() { return m_frameBuffers[m_readBuffer]; }
97  const FrameBuffer& readBuffer() const { return m_frameBuffers[m_readBuffer]; }
98 
99  std::array<FrameBuffer, N>& frameBuffers() { return m_frameBuffers; }
100 
101 
103 
104  //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
107 
108  FrameBufferQueue& operator=(const FrameBufferQueue& other) {
109  m_readBuffer = other.m_readBuffer;
110  m_writeBuffer = other.m_writeBuffer;
111  m_frameBuffers = other.m_frameBuffers;
112  return *this;
113  }
114 
116 
117  //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
120 
122  // Display A, while drawing into B.In my case, "drawing" means writing updated data into the buffer.
123  // Swap, to display B, now writing into C since cannot write into A until swap is done
124  // Display C(swapping B into C), while writing into A, since it is free now.
125  // Swap A and C to Display A, bring us back to the start of the process
126  void swapBuffers() {
127  //std::unique_lock lock(m_mutex);
128  if constexpr (N == 2) {
129  m_writeBuffer = m_readBuffer;
130  m_readBuffer = 1 - m_readBuffer;
131  }
132  else {
133  size_t bufferSize = m_frameBuffers[0].byteSize();
134  if (m_readBuffer == 0) {
135 #ifdef DEBUG_MODE
136  if (m_writeBuffer != 1) {
137  Logger::Throw("Error afoot");
138  }
139 #endif
140  m_readBuffer = 1; // Swap to read from previous write buffer
141  m_writeBuffer = 2; // Make previously available buffer into write buffer, since 0 is swapping
142  }
143  else if (m_readBuffer == 1) {
144 #ifdef DEBUG_MODE
145  if (m_writeBuffer != 2) {
146  Logger::Throw("Error afoot");
147  }
148 #endif
149  m_readBuffer = 2; // Swap to read from previous write buffer
150  m_writeBuffer = 0; // Make previously available buffer into write buffer, since 0 is swapping
151  }
152  else if (m_readBuffer == 2) {
153 #ifdef DEBUG_MODE
154  if (m_writeBuffer != 0) {
155  Logger::Throw("Error afoot");
156  }
157 #endif
158  m_readBuffer = 0; // Swap to read from previous write buffer
159  m_writeBuffer = 1; // Make previously available buffer into write buffer, since 0 is swapping
160  }
161  }
162  }
163 
165 
166 
167 protected:
168  //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
171 
173 
174  //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
177 
179 
180  //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
183 
184  //bool m_initialized = false;
185 
187  size_t m_readBuffer = 0;
188  size_t m_writeBuffer = 1;
189 
190  //std::mutex m_mutex;
191 
193  std::array<FrameBuffer, N> m_frameBuffers;
194 
196 
197 };
198
